Key Arguments: The bill undermines freedom of speech, a fundamental human right.
Determining what qualifies as misinformation is subjective and should not be entrusted to a government agency.
The bill grants excessive control to unelected officials, leading to potential censorship.
Alternative approaches should be explored that do not infringe upon freedom of speech.
Notable Quotes: I may not agree with what you have to say, but I will defend to the death for your right to say it.
My fundamental human rights cannot be balanced against anything.
Determining what qualifies as so-called ‘misinformation’ is clearly subjective.
